Reviews.Title: “Average Place - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sujayojha
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located in the business district of the European side of Istanbul. The service, rooms and stay is okay. But the hotel is located close to upmarket malls and shopping areas of Istanbul. Great place to be in after work. The Sapphire Observation Deck and Mall giving a bird's eye of Istanbul is close by. The Hotel has functional and clean rooms and okay service. However, if one is looking out for the tourist destinations, this may not be the place of stay, as there are other hotels near the Blue Mosque and Bazaar.

Reviews.Title: “Good place, in average position”
Reviews.Author: etr500
Reviews.Content: I have been in this hotel for 3 nights, to attend a conference at the ITU University. Location of the Hotel makes it quite tricky to reach the old town, using 3 different transportation systems, but it's only 4 stops from the lively and interesting area of Taksim. Good service, rooms not ne but well refined. Breakfast quality under the average.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre and Out of the Way for Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: TCWASHDC
Reviews.Content: Found the quality to be average at best. The bar was overpriced. Food buffet average again - compared to the wonderful food to be found in the city. The location was awkward and it took 45 minutes to get to the tourist attractions be either public transportation of taxi. I would only stay here if I had business in the immediate neighborhood - otherwise give it a pass

Reviews.Title: “Hotel close to the Center, near to Business Area”
Reviews.Author: jollerre
Reviews.Content: Hotel Bilek is located 150 m far away to the next Metro station, connection to the City (20 Minutes after 2 changes) and Business Area (10 Minutes, no change). In this area you will find a new Shopping Mall and a lot of little turkish business and food shops. Close to the Hotel there is a Mosque you will here, but this you will find everywhere in Istanbul. The rooms are very comfortable, the gym room is closed on Sunday (!). Just to say: Enjoy Istanbul - a town of 1000 wonders, bazars, great restaurants and friendly people!

Reviews.Title: “Standard hotel for reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Vondr
Reviews.Content: I ve stayed there on my business trip. The hotel was 5 minutes from Marriot hotel, where my conferrence was located and the accomodation was OK for the price, which was half of the Marriot rates. Hotel is rated as a 4 stars, however the service level is for 3 stars. Service is poor, bar and restaurant was empty all 3 days of my stay. Location is far from Istanbul centre, on the other hand the underground station is just 5 minutes by walk. Free wifi was always down. Breakfast was OK.

Reviews.Title: “A Turkish 4 * hotel”
Reviews.Author: SkyTeamer
Reviews.Content: The hotel claims to be a 4* property, but in US standard it would be something around 3*, comparable to DoubleTree or EbassySuite. The rooms and bathrooms are quite big compared with other 3* hotel in Istanbul. Safe box and satellite TV are in room. The area (4 Levent) is quite a suburban area, although the metro station is within walking distance. Lots of places to eat near the hotel with very cheap price. If you are visiting Istanbul, not Levent, try somewhere else in Sultanahmet. Free WiFi.
